segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and I feel so bad for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s completely unaware of the mess around her, and it’s heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so careless, and it’s making me feel sorry for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and she’s just standing there, oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall, and it’s going to be a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, and it’s like she doesn’t see the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so sad, and I can’t help but feel sorry for the woman.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pooling, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children don’t seem to care about the mess they’re making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is one of the saddest scenes I’ve ever witnessed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the tidy garden and the messy kitchen is depressing.
segments.speaker: PAR
